definition: without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
(negative prefix)/not/no
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
method/technique
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea

sentences.english: There is no ignorance, there is knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 不會不學無術，我們追求知識。

sentences.english: Art has an enemy called ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 藝術的敵人就是不學無術。

sentences.english: Yeah, and they are all laced with melamine, you ignoramus.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，他們都含有三聚氰胺，不學無術。

sentences.english: Study hard, or you'll be an uneducated man.
sentences.chinese: 努力學習，否則你會是個不學無術的人。

definition: red in the face/extremely angry
lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
sequel/continuation of a book
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to form a clique
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
